terms.value: Pause
No Saves Text
RESUME GAME
START GAME
SETTINGS
QUIT
Vitaliy
Hello, how are you?
Grandfather
Fine!
Get well soon!
Fine
Bad
Bucks
Yashka
Shirt
Bayonet
Violinist
Dmitriy
Alexander
Policeman
Damn... My head is splitting. It's been a while since I felt this bad.
Oh, our prince-alcohol has woken up! I thought I'd have to carry you out to the cemetery.
Thanks, nanny. Your moonshine is what finished me off.
Moonshine? This isn't a restaurant to serve champagne.
Well, get out into the fresh air, you need to unwind.
*heavy sigh*
Yeah, I could use a pick-me-up.
Your left.. My legs are like cotton wool, as if a tram ran over me
Heh, it's a little wobbly, but I can get to the meadow.
My neck seems a little jammed.
Lovely.
It hasn't even been a year!
You try it with my hangover...
Start training already. I'll be watching, or you'll kill yourself with a hangover.
Hmm, where's my club?
There's a scarecrow over there, it's kind of crooked, straighten it out with your club
Well... You remembered how to scare enemies with a club, now let's get down to real business.
Play with the gun, there are a couple more scarecrows left.
I've finished shooting... I'll go to Shirt
Now-now, I'll shoot them in no time
Good, you do shoot. Obviously, better than you drink.
Oh, look at these people!
Guys, listen! There's a thread here. In short, I've received information that things are worse for Gr1 than ever. Their chieftain is in debt, half the gang has fled.
So what? What's in it for us?
And that! Remember how fertile their territory is! Contraband is constantly coming in from abroad. And now it's guarded by three pimply teenagers.
What are you babbling about? Blind Yashka used to have people with machine guns terrorizing everyone and everything.
Well, that was before! But now everything has turned upside down. Now it's high time we showed up for this party of life, we'll hit them now - and the profits will flow like a river.
Hah, you're a sucker for money. What if it's a trap? I can't believe it's all that simple.
Really, Bayonet, you guarantee there's no ambush there?
No deal, guys, here's Yashka's receipt to the local moneylender.
He even pawned his hat, damn it. It looks like everything is too sad for him.
Okay, guys, stop wagging your tongues. Let's gather the lads.
Basically, the situation is this: their base has two entrances - the front door and the yard. The windows are boarded up with bars, but there's a hatch in the kitchen.
I'll take the main entrance. It's going to be quite a mess there.
The only thing missing for you is a sign that says 'Welcome, shoot here.'

Well, then let Shirt and Violinist come in through the back door, and I'll go in through that little window. While Bucks is making noise at the front door and the onlookers are staring at him, we'll take them from behind.
*silently nods head*
He probably decided to grab some sandwiches on the way...
We had a good chat, and Yashka got pretty drunk from such a surprise.
*Muffled* The cry of a crow will wake the sleeping... but not those I put to bed.
Okay, let's sum it up. Bucks is the center, we're in the back. We'll meet at Yashka's.
Well, let's go, guys. The sooner we finish, the better.
Bucks, if you screw up, my moonshine awaits you... in the form of a warming compress on your face.
A heating compress? I'll definitely stay alive for that, that's the end for the local poor guys.
Wow, you showed up. Did you seriously cut up half the house?
Don't worry, you're next.
Finish off this idiot.
Okay, I'll deal with you myself.
*breathing heavily* You guys are totally nuts.
Bucks, you're really crazy, so many corpses without us...
Closer to our business...
There are no fucking supplies here.
Dmitriy... At it again?
Just thinking. What's going on?
A murder on the outskirts. We can't handle it without you.
Have you collected the documents? Come here.
Are you in a hurry? The Cheka is already here. If we don't, they'll clean it up.
Then let's not delay, there's no time.
And I wanted to ask about Maria...
*interrupts* Do you have work? Then we'll chat later.
Hmmm
Arrived. What do we have, comrades?
Good day, Dmitry Ivanovich. In general, a body was found in a ditch - covered with leaves. An ordinary tramp: worn-out boots, a torn quilted jacket. We assume that two local groups clashed.
Hmm... I'll step away and look around
*Notices a pack of cigarettes* Kazbek... Almost full. The dead man's pockets are turned out, and it's lying here, as if it was carefully placed? A beggar wouldn't lose something like that.
*Glances at the stick* The stick... Broken in an unnatural way. A clean chip, a sharp corner.

*Looks around the area* And here... it's too clean. The whole wasteland is uneven and dirty, and here - it's as if it was swept. The ground... is loose. *Takes out a penknife, starts to carefully pick.*
I wonder if the gold chervonets...
A scrap of clothing. Exactly like the dead man's.
